Title: Application of Artificial Intelligence in Detection and Mitigation of Human Factor Errors in Nuclear Power Plants: A Review
Authors: Meenu Sethu, Bhavya Kotla, Darrell Russell, M. Madadi, N. Titu, J. Coble, R. Boring, Klaus Blache, Vivek Agarwal, Vaibhav Yadav, Anahita Khojandi
Abstract summary: The paper reviews how AI can be used in operator support systems to mitigate human errors in nuclear power plants.

Title: A systematic review of human-AI interaction in autonomous ship systems
Abstract summary: This paper is not directly relevant to the query about research gaps in human-AI energy systems and operator support systems. It provides a systematic review of human supervision and control in autonomous ship systems.

Title: Towards an AI Assistant for Power Grid Operators
Authors: Antoine Marot, Alexandre Rozier, Matthieu Dussartre, Laure Crochepierre, Benjamin Donnot
Abstract summary: The paper proposes an AI assistant framework to support power grid operators in making real-time decisions as the power grid becomes more complex.

Title: Artificial intelligence for hydrogen-enabled integrated energy systems: A systematic review
Authors: Siripond Mullanu, Caslon Chua, Andreea Molnar, Ali Yavari
Abstract summary: This paper does not focus on operator support systems or research gaps in human-AI energy systems, but rather provides a systematic review of the role of artificial intelligence and hydrogen in integrated energy systems.

Title: Towards an AI assistant for human grid operators
Authors: Antoine Marot, Alexandre Rozier, Matthieu Dussartre, Laure Crochepierre, Benjamin Donnot
Abstract summary: The paper proposes an AI assistant framework to support human grid operators in making real-time decisions as power systems become more complex.

Title: Towards a Science of Human-AI Decision Making: An Overview of Design Space in Empirical Human-Subject Studies
Authors: Vivian Lai, Chacha Chen, Alison Smith-Renner, Q. Liao, Chenhao Tan
Venue: Conference on Fairness, Accountability and Transparency
Abstract summary: This paper provides an overview of the design space for empirical human-subject studies on human-AI decision making, but does not specifically focus on operator support systems.

Title: A Review: Challenges and Opportunities for Artificial Intelligence and Robotics in the Offshore Wind Sector
Authors: D. Mitchell, J. Blanche, S. Harper, T. Lim, Ranjeetkumar Gupta, O. Zaki, Wenshuo Tang, V. Robu, S. Watson, D. Flynn
Abstract summary: The paper discusses the potential of AI and robotics to support the offshore wind energy sector, including operator support systems, but does not specifically focus on research gaps in human-AI energy systems.

Title: A Literature Review on Energy Information System Software Development: Research Gaps and Questions in Industrial Manufacturing
Abstract summary: This paper is not relevant to the query, which is focused on research gaps in human-AI energy systems and operator support systems. The paper instead reviews research gaps in energy information systems for industrial manufacturing.
